docs.description: Sets a visual checkpoint on the entire window. This will scroll throughout the page, and build a screenshot of it.

target.name: step name
target.description: A name to display at the test results, defaults to url.

docs.description: Sets a visual checkpoint on an element. This will not scroll, element has to fit inside the viewport.

value.name: step name
value.description: A name to display at the test results, defaults to url.

docs.description: Sets the match level for the subsequent check points, defaults to Strict.

target.name: match level
target.description: The match level describes the way that Eyes matches two images, or two regions of an image. For example a Strict level checks if images are visibly the same, whereas a Layout level allows different text as long as the general geometry of the area is the same. You can specify one of the following: Exact, Strict, Content, Layout.

docs.description: Sets the match timeout for the subsequent check points, higher timeout means more retries will be made. defaults to 2000 milliseconds.
Resizes the browser to match the viewport size (excluding window borders).
Uses an existing baseline environment for all Eyes check commands. If a baseline environment for the given name doesn't exist, one will be created.

target.name: baseline env name
target.description: The name of the the baseline environment to use during test execution.

docs.description: Runs a snippet of JavaScript before check commands to assist with page rendering (Visual Grid ONLY).

target.name: before render screenshot hook
target.description: JavaScript snippet to assist with page render.
